title: Teenager, 17, killed in Atlantic City shooting
content:
ATLANTIC CITY -- Police are investigating the shooting death of a city teenager who was killed early Sunday morning.
The 17-year-old boy was found by police with a gun shot wound at the 1400 block of Magellan Avenue in Atlantic City just after 12:45 a.m., following several 911 calls reporting gunfire in the area, authorities said. The teenager was taken to AtlanticCare Medical Center, where he was pronounced dead less than 45 minutes later.
The driver's wife Marie Roe, who was sitting in the front seat without a seatbelt, was pronounced dead at the scene, police said.
On Monday, Acting Atlantic County Prosecutor Diane Ruberton ruled the death a homicide. An autopsy was performed Sunday, police said.
The identity of the teenager has not been released. His family has been notified, Ruberton said in the release.
The prosecutor's office and Atlantic City police are still investigating the shooting.
Anyone with information can call 609-909-7666 or 609-347-5766.
